private_information: I observe the initial state: left peg has disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Disk labels from smallest to largest are A, B, C, D, E.
left_keeper.goal: Provide a clear structured description of the initial configuration of pegs and disks so the orchestrator can encode the initial state.

private_information: I know the desired goal state: left peg empty; middle peg empty; right peg has disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E.
goal_keeper.goal: Provide a clear structured description of the goal configuration so the orchestrator can encode the goal state.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' descriptions to produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem compatible with the FastDownward planner that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 5 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E ordered from smallest (A) to largest (E).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initially, left peg has the whole tower A (top) to E (bottom); other pegs are empty.
The goal is to move the entire tower to the right peg preserving disk ordering.

describe.system_prompt: You are an agent that inspects and reports the initial configuration of the Tower of Hanoi instance. Produce a concise structured description that lists each peg and the stack of disks from top to bottom. Do not produce PDDL.
describe.prompt: Your name is left_keeper. You have access to public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information is: {agents->left_keeper->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->left_keeper->goal}. Provide a concise machine-friendly description of the initial state, including peg names and disk order. Do not output PDDL.

describe.system_prompt: You are an agent that encodes the desired goal configuration for the Tower of Hanoi instance. Produce a concise structured description that lists each peg and the stack of disks from top to bottom at goal. Do not produce PDDL.
describe.prompt: Your name is goal_keeper. You have access to public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information is: {agents->goal_keeper->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->goal_keeper->goal}. Provide a concise machine-friendly description of the goal state, including peg names and disk order. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an orchestration agent that must produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem encoding this Tower of Hanoi instance suitable for the FastDownward planner. Provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure action names and predicates are clear and that the problem encodes the initial and goal states exactly as described by the other agents. Target FastDownward compatibility.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive structured descriptions of the initial state and the goal state from other agents. Inputs: {desc_left} and {desc_goal}. Your objective is to integrate these descriptions and output a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model the Tower of Hanoi constraints: three pegs left, middle, right, five disks A through E, moves that transfer the top disk of one peg to another peg, only one disk moved at a time, and a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Produce a domain and a problem compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
